comment_body:
@mihirpat1 
Looked into the UT logs.
Don't see output/display for 'show int transceiver eeprom' CLIs with this change.
Could you add them?

> @mihirpat1 Looked into the UT logs. Don't see output/display for 'show int transceiver eeprom' CLIs with this change. Could you add them?

The current PR is only for supporting the state DB related changes. I have filed https://github.com/sonic-net/sonic-buildimage/issues/12911 to track the CLI support for the same.

I see the o/p of "sfpshow eeprom -d -p port_name" have "ModuleThresholdValues:" and looks incomplete. 
Do you want to keep the CLI o/p this way until https://github.com/sonic-net/sonic-buildimage/issues/12911 fix commit?
         ModuleMonitorValues:
	                Temperature: 73.91C
	                Vcc: 3.347Volts
	        ModuleThresholdValues:
	
	root@sonic:/home/admin#

> I see the o/p of "sfpshow eeprom -d -p port_name" have "ModuleThresholdValues:" and looks incomplete. Do you want to keep the CLI o/p this way until [sonic-net/sonic-buildimage#12911](https://github.com/sonic-net/sonic-buildimage/issues/12911) fix commit? ModuleMonitorValues: Temperature: 73.91C Vcc: 3.347Volts ModuleThresholdValues:
> 
> ```
> root@sonic:/home/admin# 
> ```

Yes, the corresponding changes will be done with the issue mentioned above

> > I see the o/p of "sfpshow eeprom -d -p port_name" have "ModuleThresholdValues:" and looks incomplete. Do you want to keep the CLI o/p this way until [sonic-net/sonic-buildimage#12911](https://github.com/sonic-net/sonic-buildimage/issues/12911) fix commit? ModuleMonitorValues: Temperature: 73.91C Vcc: 3.347Volts ModuleThresholdValues:
> > ```
> > root@sonic:/home/admin# 
> > ```
> 
> Yes, the corresponding changes will be done with the issue mentioned above

the show int trans CLI o/p will have the Module threshold values right? 
otherwise it will be difficult to debug any signal out of range scenario.

> > > I see the o/p of "sfpshow eeprom -d -p port_name" have "ModuleThresholdValues:" and looks incomplete. Do you want to keep the CLI o/p this way until [sonic-net/sonic-buildimage#12911](https://github.com/sonic-net/sonic-buildimage/issues/12911) fix commit? ModuleMonitorValues: Temperature: 73.91C Vcc: 3.347Volts ModuleThresholdValues:
> > > ```
> > > root@sonic:/home/admin# 
> > > ```
> > 
> > 
> > Yes, the corresponding changes will be done with the issue mentioned above
> 
> the show int trans CLI o/p will have the Module threshold values right? otherwise it will be difficult to debug any signal out of range scenario.

Need access since part of SONiC teamI have now raised https://github.com/sonic-net/sonic-utilities/pull/2535 to ensure that the CLI output remains unchanged with the current changes. We plan to commit both this and https://github.com/sonic-net/sonic-utilities/pull/2535 at the same time to avoid running into dependency issues.

> @mihirpat1 Have added comment to PR [sonic-net/sonic-utilities#2535](https://github.com/sonic-net/sonic-utilities/pull/2535). Please take care of it. Approving this one

I have added the requested UT enclosure to this PR now.

@vivekrnv port_change_event_handler() is called for any configuration change on the PORT table of CONFIG_DB not just for breakout scenarios, so I am not sure where the extra 3rd argument is coming.

> @vivekrnv port_change_event_handler() is called for any configuration change on the PORT table of CONFIG_DB not just for breakout scenarios, so I am not sure where the extra 3rd argument is coming.

```
port_change_event_handler = functools.partial(self.on_port_config_change, stopping_event)
```
 Whenever the port_change_event_handler wrapper is invoked the first argument will be stopping_event.

> > @vivekrnv port_change_event_handler() is called for any configuration change on the PORT table of CONFIG_DB not just for breakout scenarios, so I am not sure where the extra 3rd argument is coming.
> 
> ```
> port_change_event_handler = functools.partial(self.on_port_config_change, stopping_event)
> ```
> 
> Whenever the port_change_event_handler wrapper is invoked the first argument will be stopping_event.

@vivekrnv so the crash seen only in some cases? not always i.e whenever port_change_event_handler() is invoked?

> > > @vivekrnv port_change_event_handler() is called for any configuration change on the PORT table of CONFIG_DB not just for breakout scenarios, so I am not sure where the extra 3rd argument is coming.
> > 
> > 
> > ```
> > port_change_event_handler = functools.partial(self.on_port_config_change, stopping_event)
> > ```
> > 
> > 
> >     
> >       
> >     
> > 
> >       
> >     
> > 
> >     
> >   
> > Whenever the port_change_event_handler wrapper is invoked the first argument will be stopping_event.
> 
> @vivekrnv so the crash seen only in some cases? not always i.e whenever port_change_event_handler() is invoked?

No, it will be seen whenever PORT table of CONFIG_DB has updates and the port_change_event_handler is invoked except init. i.e. only during breakout.  

During init, by the time the logic reaches the task_worker for SfpStateUpdateTask. init has already happened and the port_mapping is already populated and that is used for whatever SfpStateUpdateTask does.

@aravindmani-1 I don't see this log and this seems to be coming from CmisManagerTask (and not SfpStateUpdateTask) and this is not what i'm trying to fix here (Nor i'm trying to fix all the DPB <-> xcvrd incompatibilty problems, and so i can't add a UT for DPB). Raise a separate issue for this.
@vivekrnv can you please check if it cleanly cherry pickedable? if not, please create a separate PR against 202205
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/25922744/204438856-3bfd4add-b7ba-4af7-b9f9-b860ac3cb1fc.png)

```
Description
Motivation and Context
How Has This Been Tested?
```
Please add new unit test case and fix the existing test case failure.
@Junchao-Mellanox any more comments.? LGTM

@vdahiya12 can you test a case where two threads of a y-cabled crash almost simultaneously 
for such a case, it was tested before

Nov  7 19:43:17.308812 sonic ERR pmon#ycable[257359]: Exception occured at child thread YCableTableUpdateTask due to Exception('exception from thread 1') Traceback (most recent call last):#012  File "/usr/local/lib/python3.7/dist-packages/ycable/ycable_utilities/y_cable_helper.py", line 2685, in run#012    self.task_worker()#012  File "/usr/local/lib/python3.7/dist-packages/ycable/ycable_utilities/y_cable_helper.py", line 2570, in task_worker#012    raise Exception("exception from thread 1")#012**Exception: exception from thread 1**
Nov  7 19:43:17.381012 sonic ERR pmon#ycable[257359]: Exception occured at child thread YcableCliUpdateTask due to Exception('exception from thread 2') Traceback (most recent call last):#012  File "/usr/local/lib/python3.7/dist-packages/ycable/ycable_utilities/y_cable_helper.py", line 2915, in run#012    self.task_cli_worker()#012  File "/usr/local/lib/python3.7/dist-packages/ycable/ycable_utilities/y_cable_helper.py", line 2713, in task_cli_worker#012    raise Exception("exception from thread 2")#012### **Exception: exception from thread 2**

Nov  7 19:44:15.379067 sonic ERR pmon#ycable[257359]: **Exception occured at child thread Thread-3 to Exception('exception from thread 1')**
Nov  7 19:44:15.379067 sonic ERR pmon#ycable[257359]: thread id Thread-3 is not running, exiting main loop
Nov  7 19:44:15.393054 sonic INFO pmon#supervisord 2022-11-07 19:44:15,392 INFO exited: ycabled (terminated by SIGKILL; not expected)

Hi @shyam77git - The code is pending review. I am waiting for @prgeor  comments/approval on my latest commit.

> Fix Xcvrd code to support 400G DR and 400G ZR optics
> 
> #### Description
> 1. Increase the initialization timeout value for the 400GBASE-ZR module as 400GBASE-ZR may take more than 60 sec to come up. Based on the spec,  ZR may take up to 200 sec to become ready.
> 2. on_port_update_event is triggered when 400G optics enter the ready state. To avoid the infinite initialization loop, in on_port_update_event, call force_cmis_reinit only when port configuration changes.
> 3. on_port_config_change takes three arguments, not two. This issue is found when the port breakout mode changes.
> 
> #### Motivation and Context
> * Item 1 and Item 2  are needed to bring up 400G ZR/DR optics.
> * Item 3 fixes a potential issue during dynamic breakout mode change.
> 
> #### How Has This Been Tested?
> * These changes are tested against arista_7800r3a_36d2_lc and arista_7280cr3_32p4 platforms.

@abohanyang can you check the description. I think you are addressing only #1

> Could you add "UT failed" message into PR description?

Fixed, Add UT error message to PR description.

The original error log can be found here:
https://dev.azure.com/mssonic/be1b070f-be15-4154-aade-b1d3bfb17054/_apis/build/builds/81153/logs/27

Will push a update later, the UT issue is:
In current UT, we implement swsscommon mock class under sonic-pcied/tests/mocked_libs/swsscommon and load these mock libs by add the mock path in front of real swsscommon lib path with following code: 

    # Add mocked_libs path so that the file under test can load mocked modules from there
    mocked_libs_path = os.path.join(tests_path, "mocked_libs")
    sys.path.insert(0, mocked_libs_path)

However, because we change sonic_py_common to use swsscommon, so real version of swsscommon been load before we load mock lib. then the UT break.

So will check if can load mock lib first by change the code orider.
